<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>

- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.

DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.

<target_code>
Here is the code of test_header:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
test_header (void *cls,
             const char *key,
             size_t key_size,
             const char *value,
             size_t value_size,
             enum MHD_ValueKind kind)
{
  struct test_header_param *const param = (struct test_header_param *) cls;
  struct MHD_Connection *connection = param->connection;
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;
  size_t i;

  param->num_headers++;
  i = 0;
  for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
  {
    if (kind != pos->kind)
      continue;
    if (++i == param->num_headers)
    {
      if (key_size != pos->header_size)
        return MHD_NO;
      if (value_size != pos->value_size)
        return MHD_NO;
      if (0 != key_size)
      {
        mhd_assert (NULL != key);
        mhd_assert (NULL != pos->header);
        if (0 != memcmp (key,
                         pos->header,
                         key_size))
          return MHD_NO;
      }
      if (0 != value_size)
      {
        mhd_assert (NULL != value);
        mhd_assert (NULL != pos->value);
        if (0 != memcmp (value,
                         pos->value,
                         value_size))
          return MHD_NO;
      }
      return MHD_YES;
    }
  }
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other controlling expressions need not be investigated for Rule 14.3 because they are not invariant: the for-loop condition (NULL != pos) depends on pos which is updated by pos = pos->next; the condition if (kind != pos->kind) depends on pos; the test if (++i == param->num_headers) depends on ++i which changes each iteration; the comparisons against pos->header_size and pos->value_size depend on the current node (pos) which changes; the memcmp() results depend on the pointed-to buffer contents; and the mhd_assert checks involving pos->header and pos->value depend on pos. There are no do-while or intentional infinite-loop exceptions applicable in this function.
